titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 151) to amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the sexual exploitation of children.
Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (S. 151) to amend title 18, United States Code, with respect to the sexual exploitation of children.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-68, by Mrs. Myrick.
All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 21.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 188.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the House on April 9, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Waives points of order to provide for consideration of the conference report to accompany S. 151 (amending Federal law regarding the sexual exploitation of children).
